bow: am right in assuming that even in liberal households it usually mom who does the majority of caring for the kids have spent some time lurking in various parenting related subs include daddit mommit and parenting the thing that struck me about daddit was that most of the content consisted of images of kodak moments it was mostly along the lines of my kid just did something cool or funny so here picture of it there is very little discussion there compared to mommit would wager that it mostly the mom who is taking care of the kids while the dad works get that is what usually happens in most societies but wonder if it right that it always the mom who has to stay home and look after the kids and never the dad is that how it is in your household we both work and we both take equal care of our son tend to be more involved with sleep related issues which is carryover from when used to nurse other than that there is nothing that my husband won ca do for our son what is different is that am more likely to research and question things he ll notice that little dude is struggling with something and we ll talk about it but am more likely to reach out for answers it does lessen his involvement as father work 40hrs whereas my husband works 30 when we re both at home he tends so do the most caring and am take care of clearing the table making the bottle before bed etc so guess it the opposite for us also usually refer to him for questions on the kid we re pretty liberal and he does an extremely good job of day to day childcare he watched our daughter most of the weekend while sat around being tired and pregnant for example however do almost all the research and trying to figure things out until ask him to help which often takes reminders for example trying to get her to sleep better when she was younger and not sleeping also took the lead on weaning and will shape what potty training looks like partly because am sahm so ll be primarily implementing it but also because he just does think about that kind of stuff it really funny to compare our reddit accounts mine all baby this and husband that although have some other places post his is largely video game and his interests focused ve noticed the same things about the subs that seems to be the case lot am stay at home dad and do 99 of the stuff around the house and take care of boys actually unsubbed from daddit because of the reasons you mentioned its all just kodak moment bs you will find that there are more of us involved dads lurking here than you would imagine me staying home has really worked well this far as our youngest is really wild and strong willed my wife has hard time handling him and tends to loose her cool while stay frosty all day long having been in the army nothing really bothers me anymore my husband and both work fulltime my mil moved in with us to be our son fulltime caregiver when we are not at work though would say generally spend more time with our son like taking him to music class the park the lake reading him books etc my husband joins us sometimes but he never does these things independently do know if this is proving your point or not but that how it is at our house anyway we are both liberals btw look after the kids way more than my husband he works am searching for work seems fair enough it ll shift once am back at work to be honest though mothers do the majority of childcare in all cultures that how it is for us straddle weird not quite working not quite sah line full time grad student with very flexible responsibilities but baby daddy has repeatedly assured me that he will not be able to take on more child responsibilities when return to work work in the fall he not the worst we re working together to make things better for both of us but his idea of the default division of labor is definitely rooted in socialization sexism we are wildly liberal but mom am definitely the default parent if my husband and are both home with the kids which is pretty rare we re on different schedules he puttering around the house doing stuff while doing the caring he ll also just run out to the store errands etc with just an heading out no you got the kids he is head and shoulders above my dad in terms of how involved he is but am 100 the person who deals with school stuff doctor dentist appts who has to be at what activity shopping for them etc if need him to take them somewhere because ca get out of work just pop it on his calendar and then confirm about 20 times what he needs to do and take in my liberal house where we both work fulltime it comes down to our interests and personalities more than anything my husband is right brain creative active goofball so he does more of the playing and activities left brain type planner so spend more time organizing researching and nurturing solving problems this naturally puts us into traditional gender rolls but do think either one of us would want to trade places with the other my husband and both work full time childcare is split pretty evenly now that she is when she was baby did the majority of childcare but he made up for it by doing more cooking and cleaning we have pretty equal split of responsibilities in our house this is typical according to statistics ve seen but every household has different circumstances right now dad goes to school days week and work when he home but until months ago he was working and lo would come to work with me as nanny but now chef and she ca come haha love the question we are two mom family the default parent for sure she carried them though no easy feat twins it has just worked out this way because have flexible schedule grew up in family with lots of cousins and kids around babysat since was 12 and just generally am more comfortable with kids she nurse and her job is demanding she great parent and very present we do most things together but do pickup and dropoff from school am home with them for about an hour before she gets home she makes their lunches every day and we share chores all that said do dr dentist teacher school stuff except conferences we do together iep meetings haircuts and am usually the one they call when they need or want something my husband is nothing like the stereotype that you see everywhere not in any way whatsoever to the point where wonder what planet must have married him from he does majority of the housework despite working way more than full time work more regular full time and otherwise mostly take care of our still nursing toddler we take equal responsibility and initiative for household family matters and have never once argued or even disagreed about someone not doing their fair share well probably not in our house though until very recently had high stress well paying job and he was sahp he decided to re join the work force so we moved and left my job now he works and sahm for the short term future honestly he better suited for this than am my contribution is more behind the scenes making sure she has the right vaccinations appts toys bed classes etc etc not the case in our house we both work fulltime we devide things equally ll mow the lawn he ll change poopy diaper or do laundry the next day it is reversed he can work more from home than do so sometimes he spends more time with the kids than do other days he has to leave early and do the morning rush on my own only difference in the beginning has been the research done did the main work there but was also still at home on maternity leave back then so it was logical think owe lot of it to bottlefeeding though not intentionally with the first one it has given him the opportunity to reallu bond with them we had system on nights that would breastpump while he would bottlefeed the baby though it did help the milkproduction it did help him to become an equal caregiver which he really wanted to be often see dads elbowed away from there children by both the mom other female relatives there is this notion also in female heads that man ca do these things as well as women which find very sad think if we gave them the opportunity more men would like to be involved with their kids to that degree guess we are liberal however we are 50 50 household there are days do even change diaper clean or anything else that assume is mom work my husband is active duty military and am part time worker and we have kids 20 months to 10 years this is us as well he works out of town days week so do lot of single mom parenting and he is fantastic on the day to day care and is her primary care giver when am at work but most of the research and strategizing falls on my plate do work less hours than him and am the one to recognize when behaviour warrants new strategies and am the one to implement them but sure would also be in that role if our work hours were equal in the uk like to think fairly liberal work full time my husband is stay at home dad who does the majority of childcare in his own dad daddish way he does all the school runs keep us financially secure this probably does answer your question but say my husband does pretty decent job of always being there he puts my son to bed 50 of the time makes dinner when he wants etc on top of working while stay at home but my husband is terrified of the car seat he just terrified of putting my son in the car seat wrong do the majority of work in our house but my husband does more than my step dad did right now work 40 hours week and my husband works 50 hours+ and can honestly say he does at least 50 he does all the baths gets him dressed for bed and since leave earlier than him he also gets our son ready every morning and gets him to daycare we switch off nights for bedtime stories he also does laundry and vacuums brush our son teeth at night get him dressed after his bath do dishes cook and do the scrubbing cleaning do think be happy in relationship where it all fell to me it our kid not just my kid and it just makes sense that we would both care for him together fortunate that my fiancé is very hands on with our son and very considerate partner but yes absolutely do most of the childcare and housework to be fair he works and on year long maternity leave but also planning our wedding almost exclusively he shows up when tell him to yes it frustrating not sure this will ever change because have expressed how much have on my plate and he does help me but always have to ask for the help it weird dynamic am resigned to the fact that gender roles are just unbalanced at this point the mom in liberal household the default parent but stay at home mom and my husband works full time he makes way more money than ever could so this is the way we ve divided responsibilities if made more money it would be the other way around dad in very liberal household here wife has been the breadwinner for the last few years have been the caregiver have literally thousands of hours more time spent with the kid than she does we split chores pretty evenly but the cook and do all the house repairs renovations etc all in all it been pretty good arrangement but speaking for my contemporaries think the classic division of the sexes is still in play for the most part think there is natural inclination regardless of culture or political leaning to have this as the norm think it has to do with two main areas **the pregnancy and birth bonds** mom has spent ~9 months with baby inside part of it moving around and then the miracle of childbirth can have an overwhelming affect on the person doing as opposed to the person witnessing it **the first few weeks of child life where mom is recovering from the birth and dad is busy keeping the rest of the world from crumbling in on them** this is usually completely pragmatic decision based on capability and bandwidth between the mom and dad then as much human behavior seems to model these roles turn into patterns of behavior that extend past the recovery period sometimes *life* makes that transition from ~80 20 to 50 50 difficult to impossible never disregard the effect stress can have on complacency regarding less than ideal situation before the couple knows it they re acting out the more traditional roles because ruts regardless of their previous perspectives on them add to this the breastfeeding aspect that some have and mom may have stronger psychological bond than dad with the child merely because they are forced into positions of care that dad can not possibly replicate *without formula anyway* that will always put mom at an advantage for increased empathy sympathy concern towards the child children add to this multiple children poverty environmental stressors *like grandma lives with the family or more than grandma* and you can have something that appears traditional but is really just pragmatic nothing more **many couples are just people forced into positions they rather not be in but do it because that what it takes to make it work at all ** **personal note** as liberal dad *voted for barak twice love that man personally took it to heart that did want to fall into the traditional roles that mom and dad fall into it was based on my assumption that the vast majority of parent couples before me did it because of their ignorant assumptions of the proper roles of women and men that insulted women however can say now with two little ones under toe in under year that mom and do what we do because that how we can get it done best for our boys mom could work as well or better than could and in fact is now looking into ending her career hiatus earlier than we first considered she might alternately could easily be sahd and she could be the single breadwinner in our family love that but it did start out that way and for while after our start it became insane to consider re aligning things simply for the sake of re aligning them so as to not appear traditional instead we continued to do what worked until we saw the light of day *irish twins will keep you buried for at least year and half also every decision made was made based on what worked best while keeping as many options away from it open as we could *in case the decision did pan out well* sometimes that looks to outsiders as traditional conservative family and we could be any further from that not sure what you mean by liberal here for our family at least the decision as to which person takes care of the kids during the day is based solely on earning potential not political leanings we have what you would call traditional family situation and even though have more education than my husband he makes several times what ever could in my field so his job career takes precedence that said he is very hands on dad when he is home he did probably 80 90 of the night stuff with all of our kids and he changes as much or diapers than do as far as household stuff we split the chores up in way that works for us we definitely started out the same way likely social conditioning from both of our households growing up luckily we both are redditors and was able to view the horror stories of other families and was able to use that to look at my own situation even though my husband is an amazing person we both fell into the traditional roles we both cared for baby pretty equally but still favoring me and household chores fell to me we both work full time jobs put my foot down we had lot of unsuccessful conversations at first but he slowly started to see my view was responsible for the mental load most chores and most baby stuff he just had to work help with baby and should ask if need help with the chores we are slowly working on helping each other pulling our equal weight and also realizing both of our workload has doubled we are both doing more that just comes with having kid and feeling burnt out ourselves does mean the other person is helping either it balancing act and we both try to call each other out when necessary my husband is truck driver and is gone lot so am the sole care giver most of the time right now he home for few weeks because am 38 weeks pregnant and is doing lot of the primary caregiving he perfectly capable and amazing as dad but because of our situation the majority does fall on my shoulders most of the time on the flip side we are fairly conservative and while typical sahm we know several similarly conservative can name separate couples off the top of my head families in which the mom has full time career and the dad is full time caretaker bet there are more dads in mommit than we realize because they tend to stay silent it comes down to the fact that most men still make more money than most women and tend to hold jobs that are more demanding and something you call career while lot of women still just have job obviously this is always the case but commonly so even in liberal and anti gender role household logistics dictate that if one of them has to quit it probably going to be the mom and if they both go to work it probably going to be the mom with the flexibility at work to take off early when kid is sick move to part time for little while etc it also further complicated by the demands of breastfeeding when that occurs because of this parents tend to naturally fall into primary and secondary parent roles unless they re really diligent about avoiding this it unfortunate think most of us want 50 50 ideal but that is unlikely to impossible until women are equal wage earners in the majority of cases this is spot on how things have worked out between my
